author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
Lalu’s brother-in-law says he only tried to broker a compromise

Sadhu Yadav, former MP and brother-in-law of RJD chief Lalu Prasad, on Thursday courted controversy yet again when a Patna-based builder filed a First Information Report against him for demanding Rs. 50 lakh extortion money. Mr. Yadav, who now heads a newly formed party, however, denied the allegation and said he merely tried to broker a compromise between two people.

The complaint lodged with the Kotwali police station by a city builder, Anil Singh, said Mr. Yadav had demanded Rs. 50 lakh or a flat in Patna as extortion over his phone.

“We have received a written complaint against Sadhu Yadav and an FIR has been lodged,” Director-General of Police Shalin told The Hindu .

Meanwhile, a Delhi-based businessman and close associate of Mr. Yadav, Prem Chandra, said he had approached Mr. Yadav for help as Mr. Singh was neither giving him the flats he had booked earlier nor returning the money.
title: Sadhu Yadav accused of extortion attempt
